summary: The federal government faces an unsustainable long-term fiscal path that poses serious economic, security, and social challenges if not addressed. Our review of the nation's fiscal health found: Debt is projected to grow faster than the economy, reaching 200% of GDP by 2050 if revenue and spending policies are unchanged Large budget deficits drive the growing debt, as Medicare and Social Security spending outpace revenue...
title: The Nation's Fiscal Health: Road Map Needed to Address Projected Unsustainable Debt Levels
